This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=CAD-IN-DESIGN.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2014-09-08T21:38:10Z Daniele Gianni 2014-09-08T23:38:06+01:00 2014-09-08T23:38:06+01:00 [CfP] 5th International Workshop on Model-driven Approaches for Simulation Engineering (Mod4Sim) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAD-IN-DESIGN;d0e26749.1409 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAD-IN-DESIGN;d0e26749.1409">[CfP] 5th International Workshop on Model-driven Approaches for Simulation Engineering (Mod4Sim) </a> Lorimer, Stephen W 2014-06-05T11:08:00+00:00 2014-06-05T11:08:00+00:00 Research Call: Smart objects and behaviour change in resource use in the household https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAD-IN-DESIGN;7acb8ca8.1406 Dear All,<br>Applicants are invited to apply for funding for this research placement from the RCUK Digital Economy Theme (DE) Sustainable Society Network+ (SSN+) to work alongside Unilever's Research and Development Lab.<br>This placement is targeted at researchers eligible for funding under the RCUK scheme and must take place in commercial or government entities in the UK and overseas (e.g. industry, academia, research centres, public bodies, NGOs). This placement would enable scholars trying to develop a research agenda in the use of digital technologies to promote social, economic, and environmental sustainability, notably in the energy-water-food nexus in the residential sector.<br> [...]
